course_title: Spec Topics:Dance & Mvmnt Studies: Sex, Power, and Ballet
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 6 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as WGS 385W 3)
This course examines ballet from the nineteenth century to present day through the lenses of gender and sexuality. Students will engage with critical texts from dance studies, feminist theory, and queer theory to consider ways the performing ballet body materializes and functions aesthetically, culturally, and politically on the Western concert stage.


This course is designed with juniors and seniors in mind.
course_description: Course based on selected topics in dance or movement studies. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 3104, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: M. Mandradjieff, Status: Wait List
